CatDescriptText: Mr. Edward Lee, postal employee, Homewood and Mrs. Alice Saunders, sales clerk, Carrick, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June, 2, 1962, pg. 13 with question: "What's the ideal way to spend a summer vacation?" Mr. Lee's answer reads: "Any vacation is ideal if a person is doing what he wants to do, even if it means staying at home.  I want to get a lot of things done around the house and take some time out to play golf.  I'd enjoy spending more time with my wife and children."  Mrs. Saunders' answer reads: "Wish I could go to the seashore, but I know I'll probably spend my vacation at home in porchville."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Edward Lee wearing light colored jacket with circular patch, standing on sidewalk with buildings in background; Portrait of Alice Saunders wearing earrings and light colored short sleeve striped blouse with circular brooch, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
